item.title: Report E-2024110260
item.description:
Report E-2024110260

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-18T12:24:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-16
  • City: GREENCASTLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0111 ET, XHG notified ERTS of a cargo release on their concrete dock. It was reported 12 ounces of Parts Cleaner and Degreaser released from 24, 12-ounce metal spray cans. The caller reported the release occurred due to forklift puncture during loading operations. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined terminal personnel can clean the release with PPE on site. The caller reported the release will be absorbed with oil dri and placed into a 15-gallon poly drum.

item.title: Report E-2024110229
item.description:
Report E-2024110229

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-15T12:23:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-22
  • City: West Chester
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: WHILE UNLOADING FREIGHT FROM TRAILER IT WAS DISCOVERED THAT A BUNG CAP ON A DRUM WAS SLIGHTLY LEAKING. THE CAP WAS REMOVE AND REAPPLIED AND THIS SEEMED TO FIX THE PROBLEM. SPILLED MATERIAL WAS CLEANED WITH ABSORBENT AND THE DRUMN WAS FORWARDED TO THE ULTIMATE CONSIGNEE WITHOUT FURTHER INCIDENT.

item.title: Report E-2024110210
item.description:
Report E-2024110210

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-14T12:23:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-11
  • City: BENSALEM
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XNA experienced a UN1760 Biotrend Eco-Clear release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10 ounces of product released to a 6” x 6” area of the dock and poly containment pallet. The release was due to improper loading; however, the damage was not visible. The product was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one for shipment on. Vinegar was then used along with absorbents to clean the impacted pallet and dock. The damaged tote was cut up and containerized along with absorbents and pads into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024110191
item.description:
Report E-2024110191

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-13T12:22:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-01
  • City: HARMONY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On November 1, 2024, two (2) 5-gallon pails of UN3149 were punctured in transit and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted trailer and pavement and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged containers of product were placed into two (2) 5-gallon containers and staged on the trailer to be taken back to the terminal as product.

item.title: Report E-2024110199
item.description:
Report E-2024110199

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-13T12:22:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-12
  • City: GREENCASTLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 04:23 EST XPO-XHG contacted ERTS to report a spill of about 15 gallons of Acetone ACS Grade from a 55-gallon metal drum, impacting the dock and trailer floor due to forklift puncture. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 12 gallons of Acetone ACS Grade product released from (1) 55-gallon metal drum to a 10’x4’ area impacting concrete dock floor and concrete beneath trailer due to being tote being punctured by forklift. The product and 55-gallon metal drum were overpacked into (1) 85-gallon metal drum, acetone impacted granular absorbents and pallet pieces were containerized to (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to pick up.

item.title: Report E-2024110201
item.description:
Report E-2024110201

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-13T12:22:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-10
  • City: NEW COLUMBIA
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0022 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XMI. It was reported that approximately 0.5-gallons of DD2 BLACK COATING GLOSS released from a metal drum due to unknown reasons. The release impacted inside of trailer #3192004. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site.
